metadata.Description: A technology that harnesses the temperature difference between warm surface water and cold deep water to generate electricity.

subelement_relations.Description: A cold water pipe is a sub-component of ocean thermal energy conversion systems. It is responsible for transporting cold water from the deep ocean to the power plant.
A warm water pipe is a sub-component of ocean thermal energy conversion systems. It is responsible for transporting warm surface water to the power plant.
A power plant is a sub-component of ocean thermal energy conversion systems. It converts the temperature difference between warm surface water and cold deep water into electricity.
A heat exchanger is a sub-component of ocean thermal energy conversion systems. It transfers heat between the warm and cold water streams, allowing for efficient energy conversion.
A turbine is a sub-component of ocean thermal energy conversion systems. It uses the pressure of the flowing water to generate mechanical power, which is then converted into electricity.
